citations.narrative:
The acquisition records for the animals acquired by the Licensee since the last inspection were reviewed. There had been
a single purchase of chinchillas since the last inspection which had been acquired from an individual who was not
licensed or registered under the AWA but their vehicle license number and state, and the driver’s license number were not
recorded. Complete and accurate animal records must be kept in order to facilitate tracking of animals. Records must be
maintained that fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned,
held, leased, transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise disposed of and shall include any offspring born while in the
licensee's possession. Specifically, the vehicle license number and State, and the driver’s license number (or
photographic identification card for nondrivers issued by a State) and State of the person, if he or she is not licensed or
registered under the Act.
Correct by: 11/3/2023

Approximately 15% of the feeding receptacles had a rusty, irregular, and pitted inside lip, which was where the chinchilla
accessed the food. Food receptacles which are rusty and pitted are no longer in good repair and could result in an injury
to the animals. All enclosures must be kept in good repair and free of sharp points, jagged edges or other hazards in
order to protect the animals from injury. A system of timely identification, facility repair and maintenance must be in place.
Correct by: 11/10/2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)(iii) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The acquisition records for the animals acquired by the Licensee since the last inspection were reviewed. There had been 
a single purchase of chinchillas since the last inspection which had been acquired from an individual who was not 
licensed or registered under the AWA but their vehicle license number and state, and the driver’s license number were not 
recorded. Complete and accurate animal records must be kept in order to facilitate tracking of animals. Records must be 
maintained that fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, 
held, leased, transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise disposed of and shall include any offspring born while in the 
licensee's possession. Specifically, the vehicle license number and State, and the driver’s license number (or 
photographic identification card for nondrivers issued by a State) and State of the person, if he or she is not licensed or 
registered under the Act. 
 
Correct by: 11/3/2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Approximately 15% of the feeding receptacles had a rusty, irregular, and pitted inside lip, which was where the chinchilla 
accessed the food. Food receptacles which are rusty and pitted are no longer in good repair and could result in an injury 
to the animals. All enclosures must be kept in good repair and free of sharp points, jagged edges or other hazards in 
order to protect the animals from injury. A system of timely identification, facility repair and maintenance must be in place. 
 
Correct by: 11/10/2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
